intro: Chrysactinium tenuius, commonly known as the slender chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other well-known flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a sunny to partially shaded environment. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and somewhat elusive species in the botanical world.
